page.title: 08COSHESTON AREA - SHOPS
page.content: There are only 2 shops within the block. In Cosheston there is one general store. There use to be a post office but it now only opens twice a week, for two hours each time, for people to get their pensions, family allowance and stamps. The new Council estate near Buttermilk lane in Pembroke also has just one shop. It is a general store, too, and there are many families living on this estate. People in both places, and people that live on farms, have to go to Pembroke or Pembroke Dock for most their shopping. They also have to get their petrol there too, because there are no garages in the area. For some items, especially clothes and larger items, people even travel to Swansea so that they can buy things cheaper & have a greater choice.
